children.subject: Also wondering the same since my phase 2 is today.
Same here!
Sorry, I'll try to get an answer soon!
Are there any updates on this as phase 2 approaches tomorrow, on July 29th? Thank you!
I have the same question.

Time is for sure. Sorry I don't have a 100% answer on web casting. Materials will definitely be online  but I can't promise webcasts -- I would like them to be available if possible. :)

**Section** attendance will be required (times are TBD), but lecture is typically not required. You should assume though that some topics might not be webcast, such as if we have guest lectures.

Thanks for your response! 
Will there be an issue with registering for CS 169  if I am enrolled in another class (that will be webcasted) with a lecture at the same time? I am a graduating senior and would really like to take both classes if possible but I do intend on attending CS 169 lectures in person.
I have the same question as the anon above. When might we know whether or not the class will be webcasted? I want to enroll but I currently have a time conflict with another class. Thanks!
is the time for sure from 9:30-11 on Tu, Th? And if so does that mean we cannot take another class that is webcasted at that time?
Will try to get an answer soon. I assume it will follow the standard upper div enrollment procedures.
Will this class have reserved seats as well? Or will it be first-come-first-serve since it is not yet open for enrollment?
I will hopefully have an answer for you tomorrow. I expect you should be able to get in just fine, though. I'll post here when I know more.
okay, thank you so much!
My phase 2 has already passed I was wondering if there's any updates on when the enrollment will open for this class. I'm a rising senior and I am worried about getting in.
A couple people are on vacation at the moment. So hopefully Weds. Sorry it's taking a while!
any updates?
Thank you for the update! Hopefully it won't be an issue enrolling in the class with no team in mind. Really excited for this class!

I look 169 with 2 friends and we picked up 2 more along the way (we were the odd group out, LOL). As long as you're amicable and willing to group up with some folks you don't know as well, you can have a totally great experience.
Hi! Sorry to ask again but any updates to when enrollment will be open or maybe what time?

Hopefully enrollment will be open today.

PLEASE be aware that:

* CS169 is a project based course. You must be in a team of 6. It's best to sign up with a team in mind. Ideally they're people you both like and know are hard workers. You'll be spending plenty of time together. :) 

* Discussion section is *required*. You are required to attend the same discussion as your project team. We haven't scheduled these yet, but will soon.

Discussions are 1 hour a week, and they'll probably be mid-week.

* You should plan on attending lecture. We will occasionally have micro quizzes in lecture - dates will be announced at the beginning to the semester.

* Enrollment will otherwise follow normal EECS policies. A few days for seniors, then juniors. I'll post again when I get the specifics. 

Thanks!

CS169 will be open today for enrollment -sometime between 4:20P and 7P.   Through Friday, it will be senior cs/eecs majors only. On Saturday (Aug 10) all CS/EECS majors will be able to enroll to the extent space is still available (and junior majors already on the waitlist will be moved in first). Discussion sections will be scheduled by the end of today but students will sign up for "999" section so that specific discussion section you end up attending can be based on your whole team's avaiability.
when will non declared cs students be able to enroll, it will not even allow me to waitlist
when will it be opened up for non-declared CS majors? Even if just the waiting list?
is there a permission number needed?
Resolved! Thank you :)
does "and junior majors already on the waitlist will be moved in first" mean any junior major or only cs/eecs majors?
No permission # needed. Only cs/eecs majors.
I'm a senior CS major but I can't get in.
It's senior as in 7th or 8th semester, not by units based on the way campus has things set up and what we can arrange to screen for. Students should waitlist if they can't get in directly.

Just wanted to confirm that the class has not opened up yet and inquire if there has been a finalized time for when this class will open up for enrollment? It's getting close to the adjustment period and I was wondering if the class is openeded up then how will priority be enforced?

In the same fashion as all other upper div cs classes if there is space at the beginning of the adjustment period. See https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy 

Of course, you should have a backup plan.
Does it allow us to waitlist the class before the adjustment period?

1. Yes.

2. It wouldn't take much longer for one to try this themselves through calcentral than to ask the question here.
so is this going to be opened to undeclared students or now i have to look for a new class ?
I haven't / never  (:() took 160, or even 189, but I think it's closer to 160 based on what I know from students. But it's a project class, so the variance in workload can be high.

How much work is 169 comparative to other cs classes? Like is it the equivalent to cs189 or more similar to 160? Just trying to get a gauge of the workload to see what cs classes are doable with this class? I know that the berkeley website says this is a heavy workload class but I wanted to know from personal experience?

history.content:
We're still waiting on final approvals/hiring before opening the class but CS 169 WILL be offered during F19! 

We expect enrollment to be 90-100 students max but cannot say what the schedule is yet or when the class will open for enrollment.

Since the class is being offered in F19, it may not be offered in SP20 so rising seniors, plan accordingly!

Remember, this is a project-based class so do NOT expect that lectures will be webcast or that enrollment will expand past room capacity. You will be expected to attend lectures and related sections so do not expect time conflicts to be allowed. In the event that teaching staff deviates from this policy, that information will be noted when the class is opened for enrollment.

Also remember that this is an early drop deadline class and that dropping the class after September 6th will require the Dean's approval via a late change form.

Keep checking here for a separate announcement when the class opens. You can also check on class details page on www.classes.berkeley.edu.
